Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Informative \In*form"a*tive\, a. Having power to inform, animate, or vivify. --Dr. H. More. [1913 Webster]

informative adj 1: tending to increase knowledge or dissipate ignorance; "an enlightening glimpse of government in action" [syn: {enlightening}, {instructive}] [ant: {unenlightening}] 2: serving to instruct of enlighten or inform [syn: {instructive}] [ant: {uninstructive}] 3: providing or conveying information [syn: {informatory}] [ant: {uninformative}]
